intro: Ardisia burgeri, commonly known as the Christmas berry, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ericaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, red berries that are attractive to birds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The berries are edible but can be mildly toxic in large quantities.
